From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To enable System Event Archive (SEA) logging, use the **logging system** command in global configuration mode. To disable SEA logging, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Stores the system event archive (system event log file) in the specified disk. The specified disk must be already have been configured to allow for the storage of the system event archive.

Examples: The following example shows how to specify that the SEA log file should be written to the disk "disk1:":
ExtraInfo: Cisco Universal Broadband Router 100112The SEA feature is used to address the deficiencies of the debug trace and system console. Support for SEA feature was introduced on Cisco uBR10012 Router in the Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SCC. Use the **logging system disk** command to change the location of the disk used to store the sea\_log.dat file.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)To store the system event logs, the SEA requires either PCMCIA ATA disk or Compact Flash disk in compact flash adapter for PRE2.---

RelatedCmds.description: Clears the event records stored in the SEA.
Copies the archived system event log to another location.
Displays the SEA logging system disk.
